column4: gparted will shrink a partition and then use the free space to expand another, (if they are next to each other, if not, one will need to be moved.)
In other words, you have to leave free space *next to* the partition you want to enlarge.
the free space already next to the extending partition,why I couldn't add it
What kind of error did it give you?  Or... what was the problem?
I know that it works.  I've done it numerous times.
Do you have the drive booted up now?  Or do you have it plugged in?
If so, show me; sudo fdisk -l | pastebinit
May be that you just didn't understand how to operate gparted's interface.
Try again and look closely at the options.
What live CD are you using? See:  http://gparted.sourceforge.net/livecd.php
http://gparted.sourceforge.net/  #Click Help tab for more info.
i use the ubuntu-liveCD,it have installed gparted
That's ok.  Above links are *FYI*
OK,i will read it and try again
But I keep the gparted LiveCD in my breafcase as well.
You'll do better next time.  I'm sure of it.
There is also the possibility that the drive is defective.
Thanks!
Back up your data.
